alert.note: Alert for Curry County; Quay County; Roosevelt County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 9:11PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL ROOSEVELT, EAST CENTRAL QUAY AND EASTERN CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 945 PM MDT... At 910 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Broadview to near Dora. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clovis, Portales, Texico, Dora, Grady, Causey, Ranchvale, Arch, Oasis State Park and Cannon Air Force Base. This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 378 and 397. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for east central New Mexico.

area.areaDesc: Curry County; Quay County; Roosevelt County
